code: @Manual{,   title = {tqk: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package},   author = {Chanyub Park},   year = {2022},   note = {http://github.com/mrchypark/tqk, https://mrchypark.github.io/tqk}, }

title: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package
text: tidyquant가 활용하는 yahoo나 google 주식은 한국 주식 데이터가 유명한 것만 있어 주식 분석을 하는데 문제가 있습니다. 그래서 우리나라에서 대표적으로 주식 데이터를 제공하는 p, n, d 사등의 페이지를 가져오는 함수를 작성하여 배포합니다.(현재 p사만 적용중)

title: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package
text: code_get : 우리나라 주식시장의 code와 명칭, 소속 시장 정보를 가져옵니다. tqk_get : code와 날짜를 기반으로 주식 정보를 가져옵니다. tidyquant 의 양식이 기본값이고 가져오는 데이터 형식 전체를 사용하고 싶으면 tqform=F 설정하시면 됩니다. tqform=T 일때 adjusted는 아직 close와 같은 값으로 계산식을 업데이트 해야 합니다.

title: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package
code: library(tqk) code <- code_get() code ## # A tibble: 2,506 × 3 ##    market name             code  ##    <chr>  <chr>            <chr> ##  1 stock  동화약품         00002 ##  2 stock  KR모터스         00004 ##  3 stock  경방             00005 ##  4 stock  메리츠화재       00006 ##  5 stock  삼양홀딩스       00007 ##  6 stock  하이트진로       00008 ##  7 stock  유한양행         00010 ##  8 stock  CJ대한통운       00012 ##  9 stock  하이트진로홀딩스 00014 ## 10 stock  두산             00015 ## # … with 2,496 more rows sscode <- code[grep("^삼성전자$", code$name),3] sscode ## # A tibble: 1 × 1 ##   code  ##   <chr> ## 1 00593 samsung <- tqk_get(sscode, from="2018-05-01") ## No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8. samsung ## NULL

title: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package
code: library(tqk) library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr'  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union code_get() %>%    filter(grepl("^삼성전자$", name)) %>%    select(code) %>%    tqk_get(from = "2018-05-01") -> ss ## No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8. ss ## NULL

title: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package
Stock prices for the
text: dataset containing daily historical stock prices "SHANK" big korea stocks, "SAMSUNG", "HYUNDAI", "AMOREPACIFIC", "NAVER" "KAKAO", spanning 2012-02-08 2017-09-07.

title: Stock prices for the
text: "tibble" ("tidy" data frame) 7,580 rows 8 variables: symbol stock ticker symbol date trade date open stock price open trading, won high stock price highest point trading, won low stock price lowest point trading, won close stock price close trading, won volume number shares traded adjusted stock price close trading adjusted stock splits, won

title: Get company code — code_get
text: Get code korea finance market

title: Get company code — code_get
text: fresh get code internet. Default FALSE.

title: Get company code — code_get
text: tibble market, name, code column.

what: tqk: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package — tqk-package
title: tqk: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package — tqk-package
text: Support korea financial data tidy quant package. especially add stock.prices.korea option tq_get function. now, provide tqk_get function instead.

title: tqk: Get Financial data in korea with tidyquant package — tqk-package
text: Maintainer: Chanyub Park mrchypark@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Get quantitative data from korea — tqk_get
title: Get quantitative data from korea — tqk_get
text: Get quantitative data korea

title: Get quantitative data from korea — tqk_get
code: tqk_get(   x,   get = c("daum", "paxnet"),   from = "1900-01-01",   to = Sys.Date(),   tqform = T )

title: Get quantitative data from korea — tqk_get
text: x Stock x. Korean type like "005930" samsong. get get data. Default daum. Optional various time series functions. character string representing start date YYYY-MM-DD format. Optional various time series functions. character string representing end date YYYY-MM-DD format. tqform transform data tidyquant style.

title: Get quantitative data from korea — tqk_get
text: tibble
